DOC.brief_summary: The apelin-APJ system is a relatively new discovery. It has generated interest in part due to it's apparent ability to counteract the renin-angiotensin system, which is frequently overactive in many cardiovascular disease. Apelin improves that pumping ability of the heart and we wish to know if this action persists in the presence of increased levels of angiotensin II.
DOC.brief_title: Interaction of Apelin and Angiotensin in the Systemic Circulation
DOC.criteria: > 18 years old Healthy volunteers Lack of informed consent Age < 18 years, Current involvement in other research studies, Systolic blood pressure >190 mmHg or <100 mmHg Malignant arrhythmias Renal or hepatic failure Haemodynamically significant aortic stenosis Severe or significant co morbidity Women of childbearing potential. Any regular medication Previous history of any cardiovascular disease
